item.title: LEGO Pokémon Partnership Reveal Appears Online
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/lego-pokemon-partnership-reveal-appears-online/

LEGO Pokémon models are seemingly in the works, as a now-removed announcement post was uploaded early to their official LEGO Mexico account on Facebook. 

LEGO is one of the most popular toy production companies. It is known to collaborate with various franchises, such as Mario, Star Wars, Pirates of the Caribbean, and many more. However, one of the biggest franchises has managed to skip LEGO’s grasp for years now: Pokémon. 

But all that could change, as a now-removed teaser points towards an upcoming partnership announcement. Spotted on r/Legoleak (via Wario64), a teaser video for the LEGO x Pokémon partnership was posted early on the LEGO Mexico Facebook account, with a caption suggesting a ‘2026’ release window. The video has been removed from that account; however, you can still watch it on Reddit (at the time of writing). 

The 13-second teaser begins with yellow LEGO blocks coming together to form one of the most iconic tails in Pokémon: Pikachu’s tail. As electricity passes through the blocks, Pikachu uses his electric attack to illuminate two logos—LEGO and Pokémon—before vanishing into the darkness.

The LEGO and Pokémon partnership has not arrived sooner due to the latter’s licensing agreement with Mattel. Mattel, through its Mega Bloks brand, has sold buildable characters, play sets, building blocks, and sets for the franchise, including models for the most popular Pokémon like Pikachu, Bulbasaur, Charmander, Squirtle, and more. However, this new partnership could mean the end of Pokémon and Mattel’s agreement. 

In other news, Pokémon TCG Pocket is getting a new rival in Digimon. Also, Scopely acquired the Pokémon GO developer for $3.5 billion. What are your thoughts on LEGO x Pokémon? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Palword devs being shocked about Nintendo’s lawsuit against them. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Next Wave of Xbox Game Pass Games Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/next-wave-of-xbox-game-pass-games-revealed/

Microsoft has announced its next wave of games coming to Xbox Game Pass for March 2025. The new wave includes nine games, with the first dropping today (March 18) for subscribers.

As with every wave, certain games are available only on specific tiers of Xbox Game Pass. Check out the games below along with their associated tiers.

Xbox Game Pass Games – Wave 2 March 2025

The second wave of games coming to the service features Each game listed is available for that tier and every tier above.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass Games

  • 33 Immortals (Game Preview) – Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X|S – March 18, 2025
  • Atomfall – Cloud, Console, PC – March 27, 2025

Standard Games

  • Octopath Traveler 2 – Xbox Series X|S – March 19, 2025
  • Train Sim World 5 – Console – March 19, 2025
  • Mythwrecked: Ambrosia Island – Cloud, Console, PC – March 20, 2025
  • Blizzard Arcade Collection – Console, PC – March 25, 2025

Core Games

The following games will all be available starting March 26, 2025 for everyone on Xbox Game Pass core and above:

  • Batman: Arkham Knight
  • Monster Sanctuary
  • Tunic

More Perks For March 2025

Aside from the aforementioned games, there are also new perks for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers. Specifically, players can get new benefits across three games:

  • EA Sports WRC: Livery & Content Pack—Show off in your dream car on new roads with the EA Sports WRC EA Play Livery & Location Content Pack, available with your EA Play membership
  • War Robots: Frontiers: Lancelot Rising—New battle supplies with the Lancelot Rising. Unlock Lancelot (War Robot) for your Hangar with 4 Punisher Weapons, Counterattack and Speedboost Abilities, Ruin (Common Pilot), 3 days of Premium, a “Play Hard” Sticker, and the Mean & Green Wrap.
  • Apex Legends: Gold Voidwalker Injector Weapon Charm—Apex Legends Gold Voidwalker Injector Weapon Charm, available with your EA Play membership

What do you think of the new games coming to the service throughout the rest of March? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the official name of the new first-party studio at PlayStation and see who is leading the way.. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Complete The First Berserker Khazan Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements And Trophies
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-first-berserker-khazan-trophy-list-achievements-and-trophies/

Like General Khazan and the power of the Blade Phantom, you are likely to form a strong connection to The First Berserker Khazan Trophy List. It features a tough and unenviable test of Trophies and Achievements.

The First Berserker Khazan has the makings of a great action game. Khazan’s assortment of reality-defying powers mesh well with the environments and their rich color palette. The action looks intense, and some might say contains a lot of soul. If you’re keen on The First Berserker Khazan, you might want to consider acquiring Early Access—although you might need to know its PC requirements first.

Once you’ve confirmed your ticket for the carnage of Khazan, you should check out the complete Trophy List.

*This is an early spoiler warning as we have two separate lists here: One for the Trophies revealed from the start, and a separate list of hidden Achievements. So take care if you want to keep some of these a surprise.*

How to Get Every The First Berserker Khazan Achievement & Trophy

The First Berserker Khazan is split down the middle when it comes to the Trophy List. This is the first half with a look at every Trophy and Achievement you can see from the second you boot up Khazan.

Check out the names of them all and how to add them to your collection—credit to TrueTrophies.

All Secret Trophies in The First Berserker Khazan

This is your final spoiler warning before we show you every hidden Trophy and Achievement.

The list largely contains the names of bosses and story events. Nevertheless, here’s every secret Trophy and Achievement obtainable in The First Berserker Khazan.

How Many Trophies & Achievements in The First Berserker Khazan?

58 PlayStation Trophies and 57 Xbox Achievements await The First Berserker Khazan players.

An extra PlayStation Trophy lies in wait for hardened collectors—the Platinum Trophy. An extra intangible reward for earning the other 57 Trophies (and Achievements). If you’re on Xbox, you don’t get a Platinum, but you still get the pride from earning every achievement.

For even more accessibility questions, we have the latest news on The First Berserker Khazan and a potential Xbox Game Pass crossover.

2025 has many more awesome-looking games on the way. So check out our other trophy lists for the latest and greatest titles: WWE 2K25, Split Fiction, Assassin’s Creed Shadows, Monster Hunter Wilds, PGA Tour 2K25, and Civilization 7.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket is Getting a Surprise Rival
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-is-getting-a-surprise-rival/

Pokemon TCG Pocket’s upcoming competitor is none other than its decades-old rival, Digimon. 

Spotted by Kotaku, a new post on the digimon_tcg account on X teased an upcoming digital card game for the franchise. The post includes a short 10-second teaser, where we see Renamon hovering over a smartphone before the Digimon is suddenly sucked into the phone. That’s all that was revealed. However, more information about the game will be shown during Digimon Con on March 20. 

Pokemon and Digimon have been rivals for decades, with the former eventually taking the lead. However, seeing how Pokemon TCG Pocket has amassed so much success within such a short time, earning over $120 million within the first seventeen days and crossing 30 million downloads within the first nine, Digimon seems to want a cut of that success too. 

Like the Pokemon Trading Card Game, Digimon has also had a card game since 2020, so they already have an established base for the digital version. However, the title’s success ultimately depends on the audience’s reception of another digital trading card game based on a different franchise. However, fans in the r/digimon subreddit seem ecstatic about the new digital trading card game. 

In other news, Niantic, Pokemon Go’s developer, has been acquired by Scopely for $3.5 billion. Also, here’s everything we know about Pokemon Champions, including its release window, platforms and more. 

What are your thoughts on Digimon planning to compete with Pokemon TCG Pocket? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Palword devs being shocked about Nintendo’s lawsuit against them. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
